definition: sound of the wind blowing or rain falling
to blow (as of wind)/sound of wind/sough
to blow (as of wind)/sound of wind/sough
chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly

sentences.english: With 11)rustling feathers, they swam lightly over the water.
sentences.chinese: 他们轻飘飘地浮在水上，羽毛发出飕飕的响声。

sentences.english: The windshield wipers swished back and forth monotonously.
sentences.chinese: 挡风玻璃上的雨刷单调地来回摆动，发出飕飕声。

sentences.english: Hot pot is the best thing to have on a cold winter night.
sentences.chinese: 冷飕飕的冬夜最适合吃火锅了。

sentences.english: A cold wind was blowing, and night was falling.
sentences.chinese: 正刮着冷飕飕的风，夜幕正在降临。

sentences.english: Instead the angels were given a space in the cold basement.
sentences.chinese: 他们被安排在一个冷飕飕的地下室。

sentences.english: The cameras whirred and the flashbulbs popped.
sentences.chinese: 照相机飕飕响，闪光灯呼呼叫。

sentences.english: Time flew past with a whir of golden wings.
sentences.chinese: 时间的金色翅膀飕飕的飞逝过去了。

sentences.english: He heard the zip of a flying bullet.
sentences.chinese: 他听到飞驰子弹的飕飕声。

sentences.english: If you stay in the kitchen stay for a long time, it will feel chilly.
sentences.chinese: 假如你呆在厨房里呆久了，就会觉得冷飕飕的。

sentences.english: Now, during the month of February, Sapporo becomes a cold hot spot.
sentences.chinese: 如今，每逢二月，札榥便成为一个冷飕飕的热门景点。

sentences.english: It is chilly outside. I might as well stay at home.
sentences.chinese: 外面冷飕飕的，我还是最好呆在家里吧。

sentences.english: The afternoon was as grey as lead and cold.
sentences.chinese: 这是个灰蒙蒙冷飕飕的下午。

sentences.english: I especially like the whooshing sound they make as they go flying by.
sentences.chinese: 我尤其喜欢它们飞驰而过时发出的飕飕声。
早晨开始变得冷飕飕的了。

sentences.english: The cold autumn wind was blowing hard.
sentences.chinese: 寒冷的秋风正飕飕地吹着。

definition: chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly
to blow (as of wind)/sound of wind/sough
(onom.) sound of the wind or the breathing of sb who is sound asleep
to be extremely cold or painful
lit. sth hits one in the face/directly in one's face/sth assaults the senses/blatant (advertising)/eye-catching/(a smell) assaults the nostrils
